title: (x) Looking for sans serifs with distinctive curved-pointed tips - various {gang}
content:
Hi,  
I’m wanting to find fonts that have ’curve going into point’ tips, similar to the attached example.  
Any suggestions?  
Much thanks,  
robbo.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [orb-logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/files/orb-logo.gif) | 2.03 KB |

 [‹ (x) Maybe Knockout-HTF69-FullLiteweight - Railroad Gothic {Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/node/18236 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Who2 casual serif face - Spumoni {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/node/18276 "Go to next forum topic")
author: robbo

comments.content: The most obvious one is [Evert Bloemsma](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Evert%252BBloemsma)’s [FF Cocon](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11013.0.0) of course.
In fact, Cyberotica was used on many covers for The Orb, Dr Alec Patterson’s electronic music outfit.

One of my favourite [Barry Deck](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Barry%252BDeck) faces, which I licensed long ago: [Truth](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Truth/mudTyper+Weights/) from [ThirsType](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ThirsType), available through [Village](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Village).

And pretty similar to the aforementonned Truth — [NudE](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/www.synfonts.com/nude/index.html) by [Don Synstelien](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222004942/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Don%252BSynstelien).
